001package wavelet;
002
003public abstract class DiscreteWaveletTransformation extends WaveletTransformation {
004  protected double[] daubechiesScalingSequence;
005  
006  protected double[] daubechiesWaveletSequence;
007  
008  protected void initialize() {
009    initialize(2);
010  }
011  
012  protected void initialize(int paramInt) {
013    super.initialize();
014    this.daubechiesScalingSequence = new double[] { 0.4829629131445341D, 0.8365163037378077D, 0.2241438680420134D, -0.1294095225512603D };
015    if (paramInt == 3)
016      this.daubechiesScalingSequence = new double[] { 0.3326705529500825D, 0.8068915093110924D, 0.4598775021184914D, -0.1350110200102546D, -0.0854412738820267D, 0.0352262918857095D }; 
017    if (paramInt == 4)
018      this.daubechiesScalingSequence = new double[] { 0.2303778133088964D, 0.7148465705529155D, 0.6308807679298599D, -0.0279837694168599D, -0.1870348117190931D, 0.0308413818355607D, 0.0328830116668852D, -0.010597401785069D }; 
019    int i = this.daubechiesScalingSequence.length;
020    this.daubechiesWaveletSequence = new double[i];
021    for (byte b = 0; b < i; b++)
022      this.daubechiesWaveletSequence[b] = Math.pow(-1.0D, b) * this.daubechiesScalingSequence[i - 1 - b]; 
023  }
024}
